posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Do you want my honest opinion? It SUCKS! LOL

Answer me this question: what are the 6 levels of Wizard doing for you in that build? Don't worry, I'll answer: MAKING YOU VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY WEAK!!! You're giving up 3 BAB points for the ability to cast level 3 spells. What are the spells that are SOOOOOO VITAL for you to take 6 levels of a 1d4 HD, 1/2 BAB class in a melee build? You don't even get to cast Stoneskin LOL. I told you, you CAN'T POSSIBLY MAKE a strong fighter / mage build for level 20. It just DOESN'T WORK!

Yes, that's exactly what you managed: a very weak meleer with very limited spell power. I tried to explain, but you weren't ready to listen. maybe now that I've told you your build is extremely weak you will?

If you take just 3 LEVELS of Rogue, you'll have access to Use Magic Device, which is a skill that allows you to cast from scrolls. Furthermore, you'll have 2d6 Sneak Attack damage, more skill points, access to a better skillset, Uncanny Dodge, more hitpoints and you don't have to worry about spell failure from armor or shield when "casting". Plus, you'll only lose 1 BAB instead of 3. You'll also have access to Tumble as a class skill.

As I said, the only reason to even think of making a spellsword with Fighter and Wizard is to use HIGH LEVEL SPELLS in a build with good AB. You just can't achieve that in 20 levels, because you need to build BAB first, get your combat feats, etc.. and ONLY THEN, in epics, build your spellbook.

Just as an example, let me show you a build I made a while back that is a high level Wizard with good combat prowess:

The Draconic Arcanist

Anyway, sorry to have been so emphatic, but you need to hear us. No matter how balanced your "shard" is, a fighter / mage in a level 20 environment will always be weak.

Take it EZ!

Don't worry, that is possible. A wizard/fighter is just a bad choice pre epic.
Cleric is probably the strongest you can build with. Make sure you take at least 15 levels of cleric. This is a strong cleric build.

You can also go with bard, EG bard16/ Fighter4. Here is an example. You may want to take still spell with that build (see the discussion in the thread).

Another option is to play as druid19/monk1. You focus on building up wisdom. You can cast attack spells, buff up and do all your fighting in shifted form, escorted by your companion and summons. All your forms override con, dex and str, so you need not put any points there. If you take zen archery, ranged weapons also become an option.

He said "no elf" in the OP. Here's a build that is closer to pure Cleric, so he will be a stronger caster. He should also be decent at turning undead. Divine Power will bring his STR to 18, and then Bull's Strength will add to that.

There is plenty of room for tweaking the build to taste. If you don't care about turning undead, drop the CHA to 8 and put the 6 points elsewhere: either boost STR to 16 and DEX to 12 or boost WIS to 17 and "waste" the remaining point anywhere. Spell Penetration can be replaced with Toughness, if you prefer.

Another option: Take a second Fighter level at level 20, increase INT to 12, and do a Discipline dump on the Fighter levels. You could use the Fighter feat for Improved Critical and use the level 15 feat for Toughness. The Spell Penetration feat should help compensate for the lost Cleric level.
